tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: *** ******** ** *** **** **** ***** ****** ** *** ********* She is under the best pediatrician care. The first thing Dr. Prasanna does is to calm our nerves and explains what is causing discomfort. He lends a patient ear to all our questions and concerns and responds in a reassuring manner. Dr. Prasanna doesn't prescribe a laundry list as a medicine, and keeps things simple. he refrains from prescribing antibiotics. Tries to answer calls and responds to WhatsApp messages. We are happy that Dr. Prasanna is our pediatrician and wholeheartedly recommend parents to get their kids under his care.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I strongly recommend Dr. Prasanna for new born care and consultation. He listen to every query or concern we have with baby's health and explains clearly with minute details. Dr. Prasanna is very patient and spends lot of time in clearing our questions.

tags: Doctor friendliness,
review: Prasanna sir is such a blessing in disguise.. he never lacks time nor patience to listen to my questions , at d same time answer them .. d way he handles my child is with utmost love n care .. my daughter never ever cries wen sir xamines her .. I m soooo greatful dat sir is d paediatrician for our angel .. god bless him.. we need such good souls as docs ... thank u sir !!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Dr Prasanna has been our consulting Pediatrician since our Daughter's birth 9 months back, he has been very accessible and his advice has been very helpful in managing all issues we have faced till now. His approach is unlike regular Indian doctors and he doesn't prescribe unnecessary tests or medicines. He is guided by process & data and explains very well the likely cause of the ailment and also provides the reasoning of the treatment approach he advises.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
Dr Prasanna was the assigned doctor from the hospital for our baby. Our baby had new born Jaundice.

We were not too happy that the Doctor meets the baby from a few feet away and relied on his junior, and just 2 questions, is the baby feeding, is the baby not irritable. The nurse next day mentioned, 'you need to check the baby for jaundice, baby is visibly very yellow' 
 junior doctor assisting him was more proactive And logical.

Doctor Prasanna's understanding is that the parents including the mother ( who has just delivered) need to know that if new born Jaundice isn't managed, the 1 day old baby will need to undergo full blood transfusions, and it's nity grities! We feel that if doctor would've spent so much time while around the baby when he is coming for rounds, it would add more value. If the doctor guides new parents about the baby, and how to manage jaundice and Baby with the bili blanket and Lights, it would add more value. Which he did not.

Would not recommend Dr Prasanna for new parents.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Been to doctor for my son for viral fever, doctor examined well and clearly told Wat to be done he was very specific of not giving unnecessary medicines like antibiotics and take unnecessary tests he patiencly listens and prescribes the exact medicines instead of filling the prescription paper with list of medicines. I would recommend this doctor for all children's. God bless everyone.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Paediatric Critical Care,Neonatal Nursing,Paediatric Intensive Care,Pericarditis,
review: He is doctor with godly touch. My twin children took birth prematurely at 32 weeks 6 days. From day one to till date he is the most desired doc. His simplicity and utmost patience are his best qualities my children are growing safely under his guidance. We are extremely happy with his guidance and timely help.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Doctor friendliness,Wait time,
review: We are consulting Dr. Prasanna Muniyappa for last one year for our kids. He explains the case very well and makes us feel very comfortable. He does not prescribe or suggest any medicine unnecessarily unless if it really requires. He explains even the regular vaccinations before injecting and the purpose of it He is a very professional doctor with vast experience.  He is highly recommended for any kind of Peaditric treatment.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
context: Paediatric Intensive Care,Pediatric Vaccinations,Pre-Term Growth & Development ,Paediatric care,Nutritional Advice,
review:
Vaidyo Narayano Harihi is a famous aphorism that places doctors on par with God.

Where do I start?

A:His Attitude has been the major reason which kept us strong throughout the NICU journey.Being a senior paediatrician with so many years of experience we were awestruck with his humble nature.

****** ************* ** **** **** ***

C:Calm and composed with always a smile on his face whatever may be the complexity and challenges of the case

tags: Explanation of the health issue,
review:
We consulted the doctor for slight temperature for my baby. He advised us to admit the baby in hospital for observation and said we have to insert IV and give the baby antibiotics. When asked for explanation he says ok let's go for blood test and again we insisted for explanation why blood test he immediately says ok give calpol drops for baby. 
He made us worry a lot, as parents we will always want best for the child and cannot see the baby in pain. *** *********** *** *********** ********* ** ****** ********** *** **** ****** ** **** **** ******* ** ******* ******** ********* ***** ************ * **** **** **********

tags: None
review: He is very patient in listening to our worries and answers addressing every single doubt unlike other doctors. I went and returned back with no prescription! He said with or without medicine cold takes its own time to cure(clarifying lo has no major issues), so he just suggested home remedies. Which i felt is very genuine in this commercial world!

tags: None
review:
Dr. Prasanna has been seeing my preterm twin boys (Harry & Henry) since birth and he has been very helpful and calm in answering all our queries. He doesn’t hurry up and close the case without giving us full info of the situation.
He is a very humble person and makes us comfortable at stressful times. His level of patience is commendable.
Thank you sir for being there with us during this journey.

tags: Doctor friendliness,
review: very good person and reachable  in emergency.  hard to find such wonderful doctors in today's world.  A gem of a person. I strongly recommend

This was our first visit of my daughter to Dr.Prasanna. Doctor is very calm and listen to you very patiently.. Suggested to give boosters but he left to take decision on us and never forced to go for it. 
Didn't suggest any unnecessary drops for the kid. I strongly recommend to go for this expert

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: We have been consulting the doctor since my son was born. Now the matter we are not satisfied with doctor's explanation.  The doctor feels exhausted when we ask our queries. Now talking about Cloud 9 hospital at Old Airport road; they give printed prescriptions but why we get hand written prescriptions. Over all if has been a bitter experience.
